title: Calories in a Slice of Banana Bread
meta_description: Discover calories in a slice of banana bread, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per slice with easy tweaks.
h1: Calories in a Slice of Banana Bread
assumptions: Standard slice (~70 g), typical homemade recipe with mashed bananas, flour, sugar, eggs, butter; baked without nuts or add-ins.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, ingredients, and baking method. Check labels for store-bought varieties.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of banana bread contains about 250 kcal, with high carbs from bananas and sugar.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1/4 cup walnuts per loaf (adds ~20 kcal per slice)
Use applesauce instead of butter (reduces ~30 kcal per slice)
Whole wheat flour version (minimal change, adds fiber but similar calories)

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of banana bread?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for a standard 70 g slice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in banana bread per slice?
faqs.a: About 35 g carbs, including 20 g sugars and 1.5 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is banana bread high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 10 g fat per slice, mostly from butter, with 5 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does store-bought banana bread compare?
faqs.a: Often higher in calories (300+ kcal/slice) due to added sugars and preservatives.

faqs.q: Can I make banana bread lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, substitute oil with yogurt or reduce sugar to cut 20-50 kcal per slice.
